item.content:encoded:
The Devi Sukta of the Rig Veda is a foundational text for the Shakta tradition of Hinduism. Centered on the worship of the Divine Feminine in various forms, this tradition draws heavily upon the Devi Sukta’s depiction of the goddess as the ultimate reality and the source of all creation. Its emphasis on the Devi is a significant departure from traditional patriarchal narratives.

The Rishika of this Sukta is Vaak Ambhrini and the Devata is Vaak Ambhrini herself. It is the Devi who is reciting her own Sukta of praise. There are a number of Rishikas, female Rishis, who have composed key Suktas for the Rig Veda, although the majority are male. There are also a number of Suktas which are structured as self-praise where both the Rishi and Devata are the same but they are relatively rare.

In its structure and style, the Devi Sukta stands alone.

Rig Veda 10.125

Rishika: Vaak Ambhrini
Devata: Vaak Ambhrini

I move with the Rudras and the Vasus,
With the Adityas and Vishvadevas I,
I sustain both Mitra and Varuna,
Indra and Agni, and the two Ashvins.

I press the Soma,
I sustain Tvashtar with Pushan and Bhaga.
I give wealth to the sacrificer,
Who praises well and offers oblation.

I am Queen, I collect treasure,
I am radiant, the first of worship,
I have put the Gods in many places,
Mighty stations where only the mighty enter.

Through me (they) eat food, who sees, who breathes,
Who hears words spoken (does so through me),
They who do not think of me perish,
Those who can hear, I tell what is worth hearing.

I, and I alone, speak that,
Which adorns both gods and men,
Those I love I make mighty,
Make him a brahman, a rishi and a sage.

I bend Rudra’s bow so that his arrow,
May slay those who hate Brahma,
I do battle for the people,
I permeate both heaven and earth.

I arose from my father’s forehead,
My womb is Apsu at the ocean’s end,
There I stand with the land of the Anu,
The Amu touch the heaven through my body.

It is I who makes the wind blow,
I commenced (the creation) of all worlds,
Beyond heaven, beyond earth,
So vast am I in greatness.

Detailed Translation

अ॒हं रु॒द्रेभि॒र्वसु॑भिश्चराम्य॒हमा॑दि॒त्यैरु॒त वि॒श्वदे॑वैः ।
अ॒हं मि॒त्रावरु॑णो॒भा बि॑भर्म्य॒हमि॑न्द्रा॒ग्नी अ॒हम॒श्विनो॒भा ॥१॥

अहम् । रुद्रेभिः । वसुभिः । चरामि । अहम् । आदित्यैः । उत । विश्वदेवैः ।
अहम् । मित्रावरुणा । उभा । बिभर्मि । अहम् । इन्द्राग्नी इति । अहम् । अश्विना । उभा ॥

ahaṃ rudrebhirvasubhiścarāmyahamādityairuta viśvadevaiḥ ।
ahaṃ mitrāvaruṇobhā bibharmyahamindrāgnī ahamaśvinobhā ॥

I move with the Rudras and the Vasus,
With the Adityas and Vishvadevas I,
I sustain both Mitra and Varuna,
Indra and Agni, and the two Ashvins.

अ॒हं सोम॑माह॒नसं॑ बिभर्म्य॒हं त्वष्टा॑रमु॒त पू॒षणं॒ भग॑म् ।
अ॒हं द॑धामि॒ द्रवि॑णं ह॒विष्म॑ते सुप्रा॒व्ये॒३॒॑ यज॑मानाय सुन्व॒ते ॥२॥

अहम् । सोमम् । आहनसम् । बिभर्मि । अहम् । त्वष्टारम् । उत । पूषणम् । भगम् ।
अहम् । दधामि । द्रविणम् । हविष्मते । सुप्रअव्ये । यजमानाय । सुन्वते ॥

ahaṃ somamāhanasaṃ bibharmyahaṃ tvaṣṭāramuta pūṣaṇaṃ bhagam ।
ahaṃ dadhāmi draviṇaṃ haviṣmate suprāvye yajamānāya sunvate ॥

I press the Soma,
I sustain Tvashtar with Pushan and Bhaga.
I give wealth to the sacrificer,
Who praises well and offers oblation.

अ॒हं राष्ट्री॑ सं॒गम॑नी॒ वसू॑नां चिकि॒तुषी॑ प्रथ॒मा य॒ज्ञिया॑नाम् ।
तां मा॑ दे॒वा व्य॑दधुः पुरु॒त्रा भूरि॑स्थात्रां॒ भूर्या॑वे॒शय॑न्तीम् ॥३॥

अहम् । राष्ट्री । सम्गमनी । वसूनाम् । चिकितुषी । प्रथमा । यज्ञियानाम् ।
ताम् । मा । देवाः । वि । अदधुः । पुरुत्रा । भूरिस्थात्राम् । भूरि । आवेशयन्तीम् ॥

ahaṃ rāṣṭrī saṃgamanī vasūnāṃ cikituṣī prathamā yajñiyānām ।
tāṃ mā devā vyadadhuḥ purutrā bhūristhātrāṃ bhūryāveśayantīm ॥

I am Queen, I collect treasure,
I am radiant, the first of worship,
I have put the Gods in many places,
Mighty stations where only the mighty enter.

मया॒ सो अन्न॑मत्ति॒ यो वि॒पश्य॑ति॒ यः प्राणि॑ति॒ य ईं॑ शृ॒णोत्यु॒क्तम् ।
अ॒म॒न्तवो॒ मां त उप॑ क्षियन्ति श्रु॒धि श्रु॑त श्रद्धि॒वं ते॑ वदामि ॥४॥

मया । सः । अन्नम् । अत्ति । यः । विपश्यति । यः । प्राणिति । यः । ईम् । शृणोति ।
उक्तम् । अमन्तवः । माम् । ते । उप । क्षियन्ति । श्रुधि । श्रुत । श्रद्धिवम् । ते । वदामि ॥

mayā so annamatti yo vipaśyati yaḥ prāṇiti ya īṃ śṛṇotyuktam ।
amantavo māṃ ta upa kṣiyanti śrudhi śruta śraddhivaṃ te vadāmi ॥

Through me (they) eat food, who sees, who breathes,
Who hears words spoken (does so through me),
They who do not think of me perish,
Those who can hear, I tell what is worth hearing.

अ॒हमे॒व स्व॒यमि॒दं व॑दामि॒ जुष्टं॑ दे॒वेभि॑रु॒त मानु॑षेभिः ।
यं का॒मये॒ तंत॑मु॒ग्रं कृ॑णोमि॒ तं ब्र॒ह्माणं॒ तमृषिं॒ तं सु॑मे॒धाम् ॥५॥

अहम् । एव । स्वयम् । इदम् । वदामि । जुष्टम् । देवेभिः । उत । मानुषेभिः ।
यम् । कामये । तम्तम् । उग्रम् । कृणोमि । तम् । ब्रह्माणम् । तम् । ऋषिम् । तम् । सुमेधाम् ॥

ahameva svayamidaṃ vadāmi juṣṭaṃ devebhiruta mānuṣebhiḥ ।
yaṃ kāmaye taṃtamugraṃ kṛṇomi taṃ brahmāṇaṃ tamṛṣiṃ taṃ sumedhām ॥

I, and I alone, speak that,
Which adorns both gods and men,
Those I love I make mighty,
Make him a brahman, a rishi and a sage.

अ॒हं रु॒द्राय॒ धनु॒रा त॑नोमि ब्रह्म॒द्विषे॒ शर॑वे॒ हन्त॒वा उ॑ ।
अ॒हं जना॑य स॒मदं॑ कृणोम्य॒हं द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी आ वि॑वेश ॥६॥

अहम् । रुद्राय । धनुः । आ । तनोमि । ब्रह्मद्विषे । शरवे । हन्तवै । ऊँ इति ।
अहम् । जनाय । समदम् । कृणोमि । अहम् । द्यावापृथिवी इति । आ । विवेश ॥

ahaṃ rudrāya dhanurā tanomi brahmadviṣe śarave hantavā u ।
ahaṃ janāya samadaṃ kṛṇomyahaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa ॥

I bend Rudra’s bow so that his arrow,
May slay those who hate Brahma,
I do battle for the people,
I permeate both heaven and earth.

अ॒हं सु॑वे पि॒तर॑मस्य मू॒र्धन्मम॒ योनि॑र॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तः स॑मु॒द्रे ।
ततो॒ वि ति॑ष्ठे॒ भुव॒नानु॒ विश्वो॒तामूं द्यां व॒र्ष्मणोप॑ स्पृशामि ॥७॥

अहम् । सुवे । पितरम् । अस्य । मूर्धन् । मम । योनिः । अप्सु । अन्तरिति । समुद्रे ।
ततः । वि । तिष्ठे । भुवना । अनु । विश्वा । उत । अमूम् । द्याम् । वर्ष्मणा । उप । स्पृशामि ॥

ahaṃ suve pitaramasya mūrdhanmama yonirapsvantaḥ samudre ।
tato vi tiṣṭhe bhuvanānu viśvotāmūṃ dyāṃ varṣmaṇopa spṛśāmi ॥

I arose from my father’s forehead,
My womb is Apsu at the ocean’s end,
There I stand with the land of the Anu,
The Amu touch the heaven through my body.

अ॒हमे॒व वात॑ इव॒ प्र वा॑म्या॒रभ॑माणा॒ भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑ ।
प॒रो दि॒वा प॒र ए॒ना पृ॑थि॒व्यैताव॑ती महि॒ना सं ब॑भूव ॥८॥

अहम् । एव । वातःइव । प्र । वामि । आरभमाणा । भुवनानि । विश्वा ।
परः । दिवा । परः । एना । पृथिव्या । एतावती । महिना । सम् । बभूव ॥

ahameva vāta iva pra vāmyārabhamāṇā bhuvanāni viśvā ।
paro divā para enā pṛthivyaitāvatī mahinā saṃ babhūva ॥

It is I who makes the wind blow,
I commenced (the creation) of all worlds,
Beyond heaven, beyond earth,
So vast am I in greatness.

Translated by Devajyoti Sarkar

item.content:encoded:
The Nasadiya Sukta is famously known as the Creation Hymn of the Rig Veda. It speculates on cosmology and the origins of the universe. Carl Sagan quoted it in his discussion of the Indian “tradition of skeptical questioning and unselfconscious humility before the great cosmic mysteries.”

The Rig Veda is the most important work of ancient India. The Vedic corpus serves as the basis of almost all of modern Hindu thought and religion. The Nasadiya Sukta is the 129th Sukta of the tenth Mandala of the Rig Veda. The Rig Veda comprises of 10 books called “Mandalas”. They were composed by more than four hundred of the most famous sages of Indian tradition. The Rishi of this Sukta is Prajapati Parameshthin. It is dedicated to the Devata (God) Bhavavrittam which is another name for Brahma.

The Rig Veda represents a unique oral tradition that has been handed down with complete fidelity over thousands of years. Paradoxically, this accuracy has led to them to convey a voice that is both mysterious and beautiful. They talk about kings and events that are no longer remembered and Gods that are no longer worshiped. It comes from a time when humanity’s relationship to God was fundamentally different than today. Even the word “Sukta” means praise rather than prayer.

Rig Veda 10.129

Rishi: Prajapati Parmeshthin
Devata: Bhavavrittam

There was neither death nor immortality then,
There was neither day nor was there night,
That One breathed by his own will,
Apart from that there was nothing else.

Darkness was covered by darkness then,
Without form all this was Salil (water),
Emptiness was wrapped in emptiness,
Then Mahin took birth through Tapas (heat).

Desire kindled in that equanimity,
It became the first seed of the mind,
Existence found its friendship with non-existence,
So the sages discovered when they meditated.

Rays of light spread transversely,
Was there an above, was there a below?
There was the impregnator, there was Mahima,
The food was inferior, the eater superior.

Who knows it? Who here can claim to?
From where it came, this grand creation?
All the Gods came later,
Who knows now where it came from?

He from whom creation arose,
Maybe he upheld it or maybe not,
That Lord in the highest heaven,
Maybe he knows or maybe not.

Detailed Translation

नास॑दासी॒न्नो सदा॑सीत्त॒दानीं॒ नासी॒द्रजो॒ नो व्यो॑मा प॒रो त् ।
किमाव॑रीव॒: कुह॒ कस्य॒ शर्म॒न्नम्भ॒: किमा॑सी॒द्गह॑नं गभी॒रम् ॥१॥

न । अस॑त् । आ॒सी॒त् । नो इति॑ । सत् । आ॒सी॒त् । त॒दानी॑म् । न । आ॒सी॒त् । रजः॑ । नो इति॑ । विऽओ॑म । प॒रः । यत् ।
किम् । आ । अ॒व॒री॒व॒रिति॑ । कुह॑ । कस्य॑ । शर्म॑न् । अम्भः॑ । किम् । आ॒सी॒त् । गह॑नम् । ग॒भी॒रम् ॥

nāsadāsīnno sadāsīttadānīṃ nāsīdrajo no vyomā paro yat .
kimāvarīvaḥ kuha kasya śarmannambhaḥ kimāsīdgahanaṃ gabhīram ..

There was neither existence nor non-existence then,
There was neither the earth nor the heaven beyond,
What moved, in whose protection?
Was there water so very deep?

न मृ॒त्युरा॑सीद॒मृतं॒ न तर्हि॒ न रात्र्या॒ अह्न॑ आसीत्प्रके॒तः ।
आनी॑दवा॒तं स्व॒धया॒ तदेकं॒ तस्मा॑द्धा॒न्यन्न प॒रः किं च॒नास॑ ॥२॥

न । मृ॒त्युः । आ॒सी॒त् । अ॒मृत॑म् । न । तर्हि॑ । न । रात्र्याः॑ । अह्नः॑ । आ॒सी॒त् । प्र॒ऽके॒तः ।
आनी॑त् । अ॒वा॒तम् । स्व॒धया॑ । तत् । एक॑म् । तस्मा॑त् । ह॒ । अ॒न्यत् । न । प॒रः । किम् । च॒न । आ॒स॒ ॥

na mṛtyurāsīdamṛtaṃ na tarhi na rātryā ahna āsītpraketaḥ .
ānīdavātaṃ svadhayā tadekaṃ tasmāddhānyanna paraḥ kiṃ canāsa ..

There was neither death nor immortality then,
There was neither day nor was there night,
That One breathed by his own will,
Apart from that there was nothing else.

तम॑ आसी॒त्तम॑सा गू॒ळ्हमग्रे॑ऽप्रके॒तं स॑लि॒लं सर्व॑मा इ॒दम् ।
तु॒च्छ्येना॒भ्वपि॑हितं॒ यदासी॒त्तप॑स॒स्तन्म॑हि॒नाजा॑य॒तैक॑म् ॥३॥

तमः॑ । आ॒सी॒त् । तम॑सा । गू॒ळ्हम् । अग्रे॑ । अ॒प्र॒ऽके॒तम् । स॒लि॒लम् । सर्व॑म् । आः॒ । इ॒दम् ।
तु॒च्छ्येन॑ । आ॒भु । अपि॑ऽहितम् । यत् । आसी॑त् । तप॑सः । तत् । म॒हि॒ना । अ॒जा॒य॒त॒ । एक॑म् ॥

tama āsīttamasā gūl̤hamagre’praketaṃ salilaṃ sarvamā idam .
tucchyenābhvapihitaṃ yadāsīttapasastanmahinājāyataikam ..

Darkness was covered by darkness then,
Without form all this was Salil (water),
Emptiness was wrapped in emptiness,
Then Mahin took birth through Tapas (heat).

काम॒स्तदग्रे॒ सम॑वर्त॒ताधि॒ मन॑सो॒ रेत॑: प्रथ॒मं यदासी॑त् ।
स॒तो बन्धु॒मस॑ति॒ निर॑विन्दन्हृ॒दि प्र॒तीष्या॑ क॒वयो॑ मनी॒षा ॥४॥

कामः॑ । तत् । अग्रे॑ । सम् । अ॒व॒र्त॒त॒ । अधि॑ । मन॑सः । रेतः॑ । प्र॒थ॒मम् । यत् । आसी॑त् ।
स॒तः । बन्धु॑म् । अस॑ति । निः । अ॒वि॒न्द॒न् । हृ॒दि । प्र॒तीष्या॑ । क॒वयः॑ । म॒नी॒षा ॥

kāmastadagre samavartatādhi manaso retaḥ prathamaṃ yadāsīt .
sato bandhumasati niravindanhṛdi pratīṣyā kavayo manīṣā ..

Desire kindled in that equanimity,
It became the first seed of the mind,
Existence found its friendship with non-existence,
So the sages discovered when they meditated.

ति॒र॒श्चीनो॒ वित॑तो र॒श्मिरे॑षाम॒धः स्वि॑दा॒सी३दु॒परि॑ स्विदासी३त् ।
रे॒तो॒धा आ॑सन्महि॒मान॑ आसन्त्स्व॒धा अ॒वस्ता॒त्प्रय॑तिः प॒रस्ता॑त् ॥५॥

ति॒र॒श्चीनः॑ । विऽत॑तः । र॒श्मिः । ए॒षा॒म् । अ॒धः । स्वि॑त् । आ॒सी॒३त् । उ॒परि॑ । स्वित् । आ॒सी॒३त् ।
रे॒तः॒ऽधाः । आ॒स॒न् । म॒हि॒मानः॑ । आ॒स॒न् । स्व॒धा । अ॒वस्ता॑त् । प्रऽय॑तिः । प॒रस्ता॑त् ॥

tiraścīno vitato raśmireṣāmadhaḥ svidāsī3dupari svidāsī3t .
retodhā āsanmahimāna āsantsvadhā avastātprayatiḥ parastāt ..

Rays of light spread transversely,
Was there an above, was there a below?
There was the impregnator, there was Mahima,
The food was inferior, the eater superior.

को अ॒द्धा वे॑द॒ क इ॒ह प्र वो॑च॒त्कुत॒ आजा॑ता॒ कुत॑ इ॒यं विसृ॑ष्टिः ।
अ॒र्वाग्दे॒वा अ॒स्य वि॒सर्ज॑ने॒नाथा॒ को वे॑द॒ यत॑ आब॒भूव॑ ॥६॥

कः । अ॒द्धा । वे॒द॒ । कः । इ॒ह । प्र । वो॒च॒त् । कुतः॑ । आऽजा॑ता । कुतः॑ । इ॒यम् । विऽसृ॑ष्टिः ।
अ॒र्वाक् । दे॒वाः । अ॒स्य । वि॒ऽसर्ज॑नेन । अथ॑ । कः । वे॒द॒ । यतः॑ । आ॒ऽब॒भूव॑ ॥

ko addhā veda ka iha pra vocatkuta ājātā kuta iyaṃ visṛṣṭiḥ .
arvāgdevā asya visarjanenāthā ko veda yata ābabhūva ..

Who knows it? Who here can claim to?
From where it came, this grand creation?
All the Gods came later,
Who knows now where it came from?

इ॒यं विसृ॑ष्टि॒र्यत॑ आब॒भूव॒ यदि॑ वा द॒धे यदि॑ वा॒ न ।
यो अ॒स्याध्य॑क्षः पर॒मे व्यो॑म॒न्त्सो अ॒ङ्ग वे॑द॒ यदि॑ वा॒ न वेद॑ ॥७॥

इ॒यम् । विऽसृ॑ष्टिः । यतः॑ । आ॒ऽब॒भूव॑ । यदि॑ । वा॒ । द॒धे । यदि॑ । वा॒ । न ।
यः । अ॒स्य॒ । अधि॑ऽअक्षः । प॒र॒मे । विऽओ॑मन् । सः । अ॒ङ्ग । वे॒द॒ । यदि॑ । वा॒ । न । वेद॑ ॥

iyaṃ visṛṣṭiryata ābabhūva yadi vā dadhe yadi vā na .
yo asyādhyakṣaḥ parame vyomantso aṅga veda yadi vā na veda ..

He from whom creation arose,
Maybe he upheld it or maybe not,
That Lord in the highest heaven,
Maybe he knows or maybe not.
